paper_abstract: Chemora, a framework for solving systems of partial differential equations, is based on Cactus, which is heavily used in the computational relativistic astrophysics community. Chemora can help researchers study astrophysical systems such as black hole binaries, neutron stars, and core-collapse supernovae using modern high-performance computing resources.
paper_title: Chemora: A PDE-Solving Framework for Modern High-Performance Computing Architectures
